title: Salt-grilled Shrimp
summary: Salt-grilled Shrimp is a dairy free and pescatarian recipe with 2 servings. One serving contains 1237 calories, 77g of protein, and 21g of fat. For $7.07 per serving, this recipe covers 41% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as a main course. 9 people found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. A mixture of olive oil, jumbo shrimp, paprika, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. To use up the orange you could follow this main course with the Orange Marmalade Cookies with Orange Zest Icing as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is excellent. Try Salt-and-Pepper Shrimp, Salt & Pepper Shrimp, and Salt and Pepper Shrimp for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.
